techs.name: canBombAboveIBJ
techs.note: The ability to break blocks above Samus while maintaining an ongoing IBJ.

techs.name: canSandIBJ
techs.note: The ability to start an IBJ off a jump on sand. Pretty obnoxious. If we add a midair IBJ tech, this should require it.

techs.name: canBlueSpaceJump
techs.note: Using SpaceJump to carry SpeedBooster's blue suit into some speed blocks that couldn't be reached just by running and jumping

techs.name: canTrickyJump
techs.note: Executing a jump that requires very precise timing

techs.name: canTrickyDashJump
techs.note: Jumping during a spike in the speed-to-jumpHeight chart (when Speed Booster is active) to achieve a higher jump height than if done with all the available running room

techs.name: canWalljump
techs.note: Inherent ability

techs.name: canManipulateHitbox
techs.note: Taking advantage of the smaller hitbox of spinjump and down-aim to squeeze through two-tile gaps.

techs.name: canUseEnemies
techs.note: Using an enemy in a room to accomplish something that couldn't be done if it weren't there

techs.name: canSuitlessLavaWalljump
techs.note: Performing walljumps in lava while suitless

techs.name: canTrickyWalljump
techs.note: Inherent ability

techs.name: canIframeSpikeWalljump
techs.note: Using Iframes to perform a walljump off a spike wall

techs.name: canInsaneWalljump
techs.note: Extreme difficulty walljumps, around the level of HiJumpless writg.

techs.name: canFlatleyTurnaroundJump
techs.note: Positioning Samus at the very edge of a platofrm, facing away, then turning around and jumping to initiate the jump off the platform (and slightly below it)

techs.name: canStationarySpinJump
techs.note: Quickly press and release forward and then immediately press jump (after stopping) to spin jump with no horizontal movement.

techs.name: canMoonfall
techs.note: Jumping off a ledge while moonwalking to fall with an uncapped speed

techs.name: canCrystalFlash
techs.note: Performing a Crystal Flash.

techs.name: canCrystalFlashForceStandup
techs.note: Using a Crystal Flash to take advantage of the fact it forces Samus to stand up.

techs.name: canHitbox
techs.note: The ability to pass through some enemies (Metal Pirates) undamaged by shooting.

techs.name: canPlasmaHitbox
techs.note: The ability to pass through some enemies (Kihunters) undamaged by shooting Plasma.

techs.name: canDamageBoost
techs.note: Taking damage from an enemy to assist Samus in her movement

techs.name: canContinuousDboost
techs.note: A tech that involves multiple damage boosts with precise timing. No room for missing one of them.

techs.name: canUnmorphBombBoost
techs.note: A tech that involves mid-air morphing to drop a Morph Bomb or PB, then mid-air unmorphing to briefly hover above the bomb, then using the bomb blast to go just a bit higher than max jump height

techs.name: canGateGlitch
techs.note: The ability to open a left facing blue gate using missiles or supers. You only need one shot but leniency to allow 5 tries is applied here.

techs.name: canGGG
techs.note: The ability to open a left facing green gate using supers. You only need one shot but leniency to allow 5 tries is applied here.

techs.name: canGravityJump
techs.note: Turning off Gravity Suit right after the start of an underwater jump to achieve higher height

techs.name: canLavaGravityJump
techs.note: Doing a gravity Jump in lava, causing Samus to take damage

techs.name: canGravityWalljump
techs.note: Executing a gravity jump off a walljump

techs.name: canIframeSpikeJump
techs.note: Using i-frames to setup a jump from a spike floor. The i-frames are typically obtained by getting damaged by said spike floor

techs.name: canMachball
techs.note: Alias for canMockball

techs.name: can2HighWallMidAirMorph
techs.note: Getting up a 2-tile-high jump in a morph passage by mid-air morphing off the opposite wall

techs.name: canTurnaroundAimCancel
techs.note: Canceling an aim angle while crouching and turning around, to wiggle to the right

techs.name: canMockball
techs.note: Alias for canMachball

techs.name: canMidAirMockball
techs.note: Performing the same input as a mockball, but in midair, in order to maintain forward momentum while morphing in midair

techs.name: canSuitlessMaridia
techs.note: Navigating Maridia without Gravity. This is not required for simple underwater platforming where missing a jump does not leave the player stuck somewhere, or for falling down a submerged room.

techs.name: canSuitlessLavaDive
techs.note: Navigating deep lava without Gravity. This isn't limited to the Lava Dive Room, but it does exclude all rooms with just shallow lava.

techs.name: canUseFrozenEnemies
techs.note: Can use Ice Beam to freeze enemies to use as platforms, or as walljump supports, to reach higher areas

techs.name: canTrickyUseFrozenEnemies
techs.note: Can use Ice Beam to freeze enemies in especially precise positionings.

techs.name: canCrabClimb
techs.note: Repeatedly freezing a crab to climb up a wall, using no other support. This does not include the simple act of using a frozen crab as a stepping stone, even on a wall or in midair.

techs.name: canCeilingClip
techs.note: Basic variant of jumping into a two block high space and perform the actions needed to clip up through the ceiling.

techs.name: canPixelPerfectIceClip
techs.note: Setting up an ice clip at exactly the right pixel, so the clip can work without the leniency allowed by an X-Ray standup

techs.name: canNonTrivialIceClip
techs.note: A tech common to all ice clips except Mochtroid (which lines up perfectly so is pretty trivial). It requires either pixel perfect enemy positioning or the ability to force a standup with XRay.

techs.name: canWallIceClip
techs.note: Using spawner bugs to gradually clip through a wall by leaning on frozen enemies.

techs.name: canBeetomClip
techs.note: Using a frozen Beetom to perform a ceiling clip

techs.name: canWallCrawlerClip
techs.note: Using a frozen wall crawling enemy (such as a Zeela or Geemer) to perform a ceiling clip

techs.name: canMetroidAvoid
techs.note: Being proficient at avoiding Metroids

techs.name: canBabyMetroidAvoid
techs.note: Being proficient at avoiding the baby Metroid

techs.name: canMochtroidClip
techs.note: Using a frozen Mochtroid to clip through a one-tile-high wall.

techs.name: canPuyoClip
techs.note: Using a frozen Puyo to clip through a one-tile-high wall.

techs.name: canMultiviolaClip
techs.note: Using a frozen Multiviola to clip through a one-tile-high wall.

techs.name: canMochtroidClimb
techs.note: Using a Mochtroid's movement to climb upwards by continually freezing it higher up

techs.name: canSandMochtroidClimb
techs.note: Setting up a Mochtroid climb from a sand floor, where failure in a suitless environment can mean death

techs.name: canShotBlockOverload
techs.note: Shooting a large number of off-screen shot blocks, overloading the memory and making it possible to clip through otherwise solid blocks. Only known application is Frog Speedway.

techs.name: canSunkenDualWallClimb
techs.note: Using a series of rapid, consecutive wall jumps underwater, on two nearby walls, to climb upwards.

techs.name: canBreakFree
techs.note: Managing to break free of the water while doing a sunken dual wall climb, without the help of space jump

techs.name: canMaridiaTubeClip
techs.note: Clipping into the Maridia tube from above by unmorphing.

techs.name: canHerdBabyTurtles
techs.note: This maneuver involves manipulating baby turtle movement to group them together in a corner, to clear the rest of the surface to charge a shinespark. Much easier with morph.

techs.name: canQuickLowTideWalljumpWaterEscape
techs.note: The ability to get out of water by walljumping while the water is at its lowest point, and to do so in a timely manner, e.g. before a Yapping Maw drags you into a sand pit.

techs.name: canTunnelCrawl
techs.note: Moving along a 2-tile-high passage while standing up by repeatedly spin-jumping and then pressing down. Comes with softlock risks without Morph Ball.

techs.name: canMorphlessTunnelCrawl
techs.note: Moving along a 2-tile-high passage while standing up by repeatedly spin-jumping and then pressing down. Comes with softlock risks without Morph Ball.

techs.name: canCWJ
techs.note: Inherent ability

techs.name: canGrappleJump
techs.note: Using grapple to propel yourself upwards, then continuously morphing/unmorphing/jumping in midair to climb upwards

techs.name: canDraygonGrappleJump
techs.note: Using grapple jump off a Draygon turret. FIXME does it actually require HiJump?

techs.name: canGrappleClip
techs.note: Using Grapple on an enemy to clip into a wall

techs.name: canSingleHBJ
techs.note: A horizontal bomb jump using a single bomb. Since it uses one bomb, it works with PBs as well.

techs.name: canDoubleHBJ
techs.note: A horizontal bomb jump using two bombs. Longer range than single HBJ.

techs.name: canSnailClip
techs.note: Manipulating a snail's position to setup a ceiling clip

techs.name: canManipulateMellas
techs.note: The ability to identify a bug enemy that moves in a diving pattern (Mellow, Mella, or Menu) and inches upwards or downwards with each dive, and then make it dive repeatedly until it is at the proper height to execute a strat

techs.name: canSnailClimb
techs.note: Piggybacking on top of a climbing snail to get up a wall

techs.name: canBombJumpBreakFree
note: From a submerged platform, setting up a single bomb jump above the water line to propel Samus up and out of the water.
It only takes one bomb but for leniency we will allow 5 PBs if morph bombs are not available.

techs.name: canSuperReachAround
techs.note: The ability to shoot a Super Missile at a precise location to hit an offscreen inanimate target, e.g. a Super block. Leniency applied to 3 attempts.

techs.name: canSpringBallWalljumpMidAir
techs.note: A springball jump that starts with a walljump to gain more height. Often relies on the momentum change when equipping or unequipping SpringBall while morphed and moving horizontally.

techs.name: canXRayClimb
techs.note: Enter the partner door with a stationary spinjump moving away to touch the transition with momentum that will get you stuck in the destination door.  Then use the X-Ray's forced standup trick to climb up through in-bound walls

techs.name: canXRayStandUp
techs.note: Force Samus to stand up, from a crouching position, by canceling use of the XRay Scope while turning around

techs.name: canXRayClimbOOB
techs.note: Using the X-Ray climb tech to enter a tile not recognized by the game map.

techs.name: canQuickCrumbleEscape
techs.note: The combination of a crumble quick drop, and landing on a lower surface and jumping back over the crumble block before it re-forms.

techs.name: canCrumbleJump
techs.note: The ability to reliably jump while landing on a crumble block. This may employ the small amount of jump buffering the game offers.

techs.name: canCrumbleSpinJump
techs.note: The ability to reliably spin jump while landing on a crumble block. This is much tighter than regular crumble jumps because the jump buffering does not help.

techs.name: canIceZebetitesSkip
techs.note: Being able to glitch through the Mother Brain zebetites by using a frozen Rinka and iFrames.

techs.name: canSpeedZebetitesSkip
techs.note: Being able to glitch through the Mother Brain zebetites by using a shinespark and iFrames.

techs.name: canMorphZebetiteSkip
techs.note: Being able to glitch through the second Zebetite barrier, clipping into it by morphing onto a frozen Rinka.

techs.name: hasPatience
techs.note: Executing a strat that requires waiting or doing the same thing over and over again for over 3 minutes, even with good execution
